item.title: Anduril has invented a wild new drone flying contest where jobs are the prize
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: This is a race series for software programmers and the brainchild of founder Palmer Luckey, he tells TechCrunch.

item.title: Anthropic reportedly upped its latest raise to $20B
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Anthropic looks to raise $20 billion at more than $300 billion valuation, according to reports.

item.title: Northwood Space secures a $100M Series B and a $50M Space Force contract
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: With so much interest in funding space tech, hard tech, and defense tech right now, Mendler said this was an opportunity for her company to grow responsibly and quickly.

item.title: Qualcomm backs SpotDraft to scale on-device contract AI with valuation doubling toward $400M
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: SpotDraft now processes over 1 million contracts annually using its AI tool, with contract volumes up 173% year-over-year.

item.title: South Korea’s Edenlux set for US debut of eye-strain wellness device
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Edenlux builds wearable tech to protect and train your eyes, inspired by its founder’s personal vision recovery.

item.title: AI chip startup Ricursive hits $4B valuation two months after launch
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Ricursive joins Recursive and Unconventional AI in raising massive funds at multi-billion valuations out of the gate.

item.title: AI startup CVector raises $5M for its industrial ‘nervous system’
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Now, founders Richard Zhang and Tyler Ruggles are tasked with a bigger challenge: showing customers and investors how this AI-powered software layer translates to real savings on an industrial scale.

item.title: Only 5 days left: Over half of the first 500 TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 plus-one passes at 50% off are already gone
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Register now to save up to $680 on your TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 pass and get a +1 ticket at 50% off. Offer ends this Friday, January 30.

item.title: Humans& thinks coordination is the next frontier for AI, and they’re building a model to prove it
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Humans&, a new startup founded by alumni of Anthropic, Meta, OpenAI, xAI, and Google DeepMind, is building the next generation of foundation models for collaboration, not chat.

item.title: How PopWheels helped a food cart ditch generators for e-bike batteries
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: PopWheels realized its battery-swapping network could be used for more than food delivery workers who need to charge their e-bikes. Now it's planning for an "aggressive rollout" this summer.

item.title: Legal AI giant Harvey acquires Hexus as competition heats up in legal tech
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Hexus founder and CEO Sakshi Pratap, who previously held engineering roles at Walmart, Oracle, and Google, tells TechCrunch that her San Francisco-based team has already joined Harvey, while the startup's India-based engineers will come onboard once Harvey establishes a Bangalore office.

item.title: The Rippling/Deel corporate spying scandal may have taken another wild turn
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The Department of Justice may be conducting a criminal investigation. This is arguably the biggest drama between two HR startups ever.

item.title: How did Davos turn into a tech conference?
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: The World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos felt different this year, and not just because Meta and Salesforce took over storefronts on the main promenade. AI dominated the conversation in a way that overshadowed traditional topics like climate change and global poverty, and the CEOs weren’t holding back. There was public criticism of trade policy, warnings about AI […]

item.title: This startup will send 1,000 people’s ashes to space — affordably — in 2027
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Started by an engineer who worked on the space shuttle program, and at Blue Origin, Space Beyond has a spot on a 2027 Falcon 9 flight.

item.title: AI CEOs transformed Davos into a tech conference
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane
item.description: The World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos felt different this year, and not just because Meta and Salesforce took over storefronts on the main promenade. AI dominated the conversation in a way that overshadowed traditional topics like climate change and global poverty, and the CEOs weren’t holding back. There was public criticism of trade policy, warnings about AI […]

item.title: OpenAI chief Sam Altman plans India visit as AI leaders converge in New Delhi: sources
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The visit comes as New Delhi prepares to host a major AI summit expected to draw top executives from Meta, Google, and Anthropic. This will be Altman's first visit to the country in nearly a year.

item.title: Only 1 week left (or until the first 500 passes are gone): The first TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 ticket discount is ending
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Register now to save up to $680 on your TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 pass and get a second ticket at 50% off. This offer ends next week on January 30, or once the first 500 tickets are claimed — whichever comes first.

item.title: Former Sequoia partner’s new startup uses AI to negotiate your calendar for you
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Blockit, an AI agent that communicates directly with other calendars, has raised $5 million in seed funding led by Sequoia.

item.title: Palmer Luckey says the coolest thing about Anduril expanding is the fighter jets
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Anduril on Thursday announced its plans to expand its Southern California presence with a major campus in Long Beach, the town where founder Palmer Luckey grew up.

item.title: OpenAI is coming for those sweet enterprise dollars in 2026
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: OpenAI has reportedly appointed Barret Zoph to lead its push into enterprise just a week after Zoph rejoined the company.
